title: New: The Townhouses – Diaspora feat. Guerre
content:
The rather marvelous thing about Sydney based music at the moment is the speed in which it crafts out new and interesting sounds, if you take your eyes off the city for a moment, it’s likely to have churned out a load of new tunes that results in a fairly hefty catch-up.

On the one side you have Groundislava style glitch through the likes of Bon Rat, Bon Rat, FISHING and Oscar Key Sung and on the other, some rather oddly soulful material from the likes of Guerre, The Townhouses and Oliver Tank. As it happens Guerrre and The Townhouses have teamed up for this rather striking new cut from Townhouses’ new album, The Diaspora.

The track, also entitled The Diaspora, is a stripped down, subtly anthemic ballad that manages to sound quaintly similar to the Cinematic Orchestra’s ‘To Build a Home’.

The Townhouses drop the Diaspora album through Bandcamp and iTunes on November 20.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d24
